subject: Psychology
title: The History of Habit Research
description: A short lesson to help you apply The History of Habit Research.

hook.text: William James wrote about habits in 1890. Over a century later, science finally caught up with his intuition.

buildup.text: James argued that habit simplifies life, frees attention, and is the 'flywheel of society.'

discovery.text: Behaviorists like Thorndike and Skinner studied habits through rewards and punishments in animal experiments.

twist.text: Modern neuroscience revealed that habits aren't just behavior â€” they're encoded in specific brain circuits.

climax.text: From philosophy to behaviorism to neuroscience, habits have been recognized as the backbone of daily life.

punchline.text: James knew in 1890 what neuroscience proved in 2000.

quiz.question: Who wrote about habits as the 'flywheel of society' in 1890?
